tweets.text: It is difficult to overstate how much that CNN forum after Parkland, with the @DLoesch-bashing and Sheriff Israel preening, reaffirmed suspicions among gun owners & Second Amendment activists of the bad faith of gun control advocates.

The events of today are a reminder: America doesn’t have a school, nightclub, or theater problem. America has a gun problem.

And as long as the NRA continues to buy lawmakers and suffocate our voices, we will have a gun problem.

It’s time to fix this.
https://t.co/vKjn3ZdXuI

@witchelli @NRA @AnnualMeetings I collect firearms. I have them in neat little green felt cases and care for them and the history they represent. Somehow I also can recall that while I have a right to own guns it is constitutional to regulate said guns. NRA seems to forget that.

Trump’s post-Parkland tough talk on guns was nothing but hot air. Republican interests clearly lie with the NRA — not with or for the majority of Americans who support common-sense gun reform. The people of this country deserve better. #Enough https://t.co/Ftjh8HjGIA

At the NRA convention, Vice President Mike Pence called the gun lobby “one of the most potent forces for good in the United States of America.” After all the tragedies families and communities have endured, this is unconscionable.

Dear @realDonaldTrump,

Politicians who put money from a gun lobby over the safety of our children should be voted out of office!

Sincerely,
America
